overview.title: Cookies: The Non-Scary Version
overview.content:
Cookies are tiny text files that live on your device when you visit websites. They're not programs, can't install viruses, and mostly just remember boring stuff like 'this person prefers dark mode.'

At OPTIMO, we use cookies to make the site work properly, remember your preferences, and understand what features people actually use. No creepy tracking, no selling your data to shadowy corporations.

We believe in being straight with you about cookies. You control what's on, what's off, and we'll still love you either way.

types.title: Our Cookie Menu
types.content:
**Essential Cookies (Can't Turn Off):**
• Login tokens (so you stay logged in)
• Security cookies (keep the bad guys out)
• Load balancing (so the site doesn't crash)
• CSRF tokens (more security stuff)

**Performance Cookies:**
• Google Analytics (see what pages people visit)
• Speed monitoring (find slow pages)
• Error tracking (catch bugs)
• Feature usage (what's popular)

**Functional Cookies:**
• Language choice (English/Spanish/etc)
• Theme preference (dark mode FTW)
• Form memory (don't lose your work)
• Dashboard layout (your way)

**Marketing Cookies:**
• Ad campaign tracking (did our ads work?)
• Social media pixels (Facebook knows you were here)
• Conversion tracking (who became customers)
• Retargeting (those ads that follow you)

**Third-Party Cookies:**
• Google stuff (Analytics, Ads)
• Social networks (for sharing)
• Support chat (Intercom)
• Payment processing (Stripe)

usage.title: Why We Cookie
usage.content:
**Making Things Work:**
• Keep you logged in (imagine logging in every click)
• Remember your language (no constant switching)
• Save form progress (don't lose that data)
• Store your preferences (dark mode stays dark)

**Making Things Better:**
• See which features get used (or ignored)
• Find broken stuff faster
• Measure page speed (slow = bad)
• Understand user journeys (where people get stuck)

**Making Things Yours:**
• Remember your dashboard setup
• Keep your timezone correct
• Show relevant features first
• Hide stuff you don't use

**Marketing (If You Allow):**
• Know which ads actually work
• Stop showing you the same ad 1000 times
• Track if marketing emails convert
• Measure campaign success

**Keeping Things Safe:**
• Block hack attempts
• Prevent fake requests
• Maintain secure sessions
• Detect suspicious patterns

thirdParty.title: Other People's Cookies
thirdParty.content:
**Google Gang:**
• Google Analytics: Tells us visitor stats (anonymized)
• Google Tag Manager: Manages all the tracking tags
• Google Ads: Knows if our ads brought you here
• reCAPTCHA: Proves you're human

**Social Squad:**
• LinkedIn: For easy login and sharing
• Twitter: Embed tweets, share stuff
• Facebook: Those like buttons and pixels
• YouTube: Watch videos without leaving

**Support Stars:**
• Intercom: That chat bubble for help
• Zendesk: Tracks support tickets
• Hotjar: Shows where people click (anonymized)

**Payment Pals:**
• Stripe: Processes payments securely
• PayPal: Alternative payment option
• Apple/Google Pay: Mobile payments

**Infrastructure:**
• Cloudflare: Makes site fast and secure
• AWS: Delivers images quickly
• Font services: Pretty typography

All these third parties have their own privacy policies. We pick partners who respect privacy, but check their policies too.

duration.title: Cookie Lifespans
duration.content:
**Session Cookies (Gone When You Close Browser):**
• Login sessions
• Temporary preferences
• Form data in progress
• Shopping cart contents

**Persistent Cookies (Stick Around):**
• Remember me tokens
• Language preferences
• Theme settings
• Analytics IDs

**How Long They Last:**
• Essential: Session or up to 1 year
• Performance: Up to 2 years (industry standard)
• Functional: Up to 1 year
• Marketing: Up to 1 year
• Third-party: Whatever they decide

**Where They Live:**
• On your device (not our servers)
• In your browser's cookie jar
• Encrypted if they contain anything sensitive
• Auto-deleted when expired

**Size Limits:**
• Max 4KB per cookie (tiny!)
• Limited number per site
• We keep them small for speed
• Regular cleanup of old ones

managing.title: Take Control
managing.content:
**Browser Controls:**
• Every browser lets you manage cookies
• Block all, some, or none
• Delete whenever you want
• Set up auto-delete on close

**Our Cookie Dashboard:**
• Click the cookie icon anytime
• Turn categories on/off
• See exactly what's active
• Changes save instantly

**Opt-Out Options:**
• Google Analytics: Install their opt-out plugin
• Marketing: Just turn them off in our dashboard
• Third-party: Use browser privacy mode
• Nuclear option: Block all cookies (site might break)

**Mobile Settings:**
• iOS: Settings > Safari > Privacy
• Android: Chrome > Settings > Cookies
• Apps: Check each app's settings
• Sync: Manage across devices

**What Happens If You Block:**
• Essential blocked = site won't work properly
• Performance blocked = we can't improve things
• Functional blocked = re-enter everything always
• Marketing blocked = random ads instead of relevant ones

legal.title: The Legal Stuff
legal.content:
**GDPR (Europe):**
• We ask before setting non-essential cookies
• Essential cookies don't need permission (legal basis: legitimate interest)
• You can change your mind anytime
• We document everything for compliance

**CCPA (California):**
• You can see what cookies collect personal info
• Delete cookie data anytime
• We don't sell cookie data (or any data)
• No discrimination for privacy choices

**Other Places:**
• We follow local privacy laws
• Regular legal reviews
• Privacy assessments for new cookies
• Transparent about everything

**Your Consent:**
• Specific consent for each category
• Easy to withdraw anytime
• Granular control (not all-or-nothing)
• We ask again after a year

**Your Rights:**
• Know what cookies we use
• Correct any wrong data
• Delete cookie data
• Export your preferences

updates.title: When Things Change
updates.content:
**Policy Updates:**
• We review annually (boring but necessary)
• Big changes = we email you
• Keep using the site = you accept updates
• Old versions available if you're nostalgic

**How We Tell You:**
• Email blast for major changes
• Big banner on site for 30 days
• Clear effective date
• Plain English summary of changes

**Version Control:**
• Every version dated and saved
• Track what changed when
• Lawyers review everything
• Consider user impact

**Your Options:**
• Read the changes (or don't)
• Update your preferences
• Ask us questions
• Leave if you hate the changes (but don't)

consent.title: The Bottom Line
consent.description: Use our site = accept essential cookies. Everything else is your choice. Change your mind anytime. We're cool like that.

withoutCookies.question: Can I use OPTIMO without any cookies?
withoutCookies.answer: Essential cookies must stay on or things break. Turn off everything else if you want—we built it to work either way.

updateFrequency.question: How often does this policy change?
updateFrequency.answer: We review yearly or when something big changes. You'll get an email and see a banner if we update anything important.

dataSharing.question: Do you sell my cookie data?
dataSharing.answer: Hell no. We don't sell any data, cookie or otherwise. Some service providers see cookie data to make things work, but that's it.

deleteCookies.question: How do I nuke all cookies?
deleteCookies.answer: Browser settings > Privacy > Clear cookies. Each browser is different, but they all have this option. Or use our preference center.
